alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 9:19AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Illinois... East Branch Du Page River at Bolingbrook affecting Will and DuPage Counties. Kankakee River near Wilmington affecting Will, Kankakee and Grundy Counties. Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. For the Kankakee River...including Dunns Bridge, Shelby, Momence, Wilmington...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Sugar Creek at Milford. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, low-lying sections of Legion Park are inundated in Watseka. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.9 feet Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 1200 AM CST late tonight.
